data: OB Induction of Labour with Mifepristone and Misoprostol (Multiphase)
This order set is intended for medical termination of pregnancy and stillbirth - DO NOT USE for viable fetus
Nurse to initiate the Induction of Labour phase of this plan
q4h, then q1h when in active labour
When membranes rupture for 2 hours AND temperature is greater than or equal to 39 DegC OR if delivery has not occurred within 24 hours
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Start: Other (Please Specify), Advance to: Clear Fluid Diet, From Maternity/Lactation Diet, when in active labour
After delivery of the fetus until delivery of the placenta
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 80 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Do not select miFEPRIStone if it has been given as an outpatient
Consider consulting pharmacy before ordering miFEPRIstone if patient is on multiple medications and requires review for drug interactions

Considerations (Pre-Existing Medical Conditions):  
- Renal or Hepatic failure: Do not administer miFEPRIStone if there is advanced renal or hepatic failure  
- Asthma or COPD: Do not administer miFEPRIStone if severe and uncontrolled asthma or COPD  
- Adrenal Failure: Do not administer miFEPRIStone because of the anti-glucocorticoid effect  
- Cardiac (Long QT Syndrome): Do not administer miFEPRIstone as risk of arrhythmia. miFEPRIstone may prolong the QTc interval. miFEPRIstone is contraindicated in patients with a history of prolonged QTc  
- Haemorrhagic Disorders: Consult hematology. miFEPRIstone may increase risk of bleeding  
- Porphyria: Do not administer as miFEPRIstone can precipitate or exacerbate attacks of acute porphyria  
- Diabetes:  Consult endocrine when admitted for induction. miFEPRIstone can affect glucose metabolism

Additional considerations (Medications):  
- Assess if patient is on anticoagulants and consider consulting Hematology and Anesthesia  
- Steroids (including inhaled steroids): consider consulting OB Internal Medicine if patient is taking steroids regarding indication and stress dose steroids at delivery  
- miFEPRIstone may prolong the QTc interval. If patient is on, or is expected to receive, multiple QTc prolonging medications, consider doing an ECG. miFEPRIstone is contraindicated in patients with a history of prolonged QTc
200 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab
Right click and modify the following communication order to document date/time miFEPRIstone has been given as outpatient
miFEPRIstone has been given as an outpatient on date/time: ______
Re-evaluate miSOPROStol if undelivered after 24 hours
For no uterine scar less than 34 Weeks gestation

For no uterine scar greater than or equal to 34 Weeks gestation
100 mcg, vaginal, q3h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
For previous Caesarean section less than 24 Weeks gestation
200 mcg, vaginal, q3h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
For previous Caesarean section greater than or equal to 24 Weeks gestation
50 mcg, vaginal, once, drug form: tab
100 mcg, vaginal, q3h, order duration: 21 hour, drug form: tab
Other doses or routes of administration
50 mcg, buccal, q3h, drug form: tab

oxytocin continuous infusion (0.1 units/mL) in NS
oxytocin continuous infusion (0.1 units/mL) in NS
200 mcg, buccal, once, drug form: tab
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, sublingual, q6h, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
dose range: 650 to 975 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: tab
dose range: 650 to 975 mg, rectal, q4h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: supp
500 mg, PO, q12h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
If hydromorphone or morphine selected, select metoclopramide

10 mg, PO, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
10 mg, IV, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
Refer to Fentanyl: Protocol for Labour

50 mg, IM, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj

Notify anesthesia for consideration of epidural catheter insertion for moderate to severe pain

Discharge Planning or Coordinate of Care
Nurse to initiate Post Delivery phase of this PowerPlan
Discontinue the Induction of Labour phase of the OB Induction of Labour with Mifepristone and Misoprostol PowerPlan
q15min for 1 hour, then q1h until stable, then qshift
q15min for 1 hour, then q1h until stable, then q4h
q15min for 1 hour, then q1h until stable, then q6h
PRN, If patient unable to void x 3, insert catheter
If placenta retained for more than 2 hours post-delivery

once, before breakfast when tolerating diet. If not staying overnight, instruct patient to test at home before breakfast and call MD if greater than 6 mmol/L. If unable to test at home, have provider to arrange a GTT at 6 to 12 weeks post delivery
once, before breakfast when tolerating diet
qdaily, before breakfast when tolerating diet

once PRN, before breakfast. Repeat next morning before breakfast if greater than 6 mmol/L on the first day of testing. If repeat blood glucose greater than 6 mmol/L, call endocrinologist prior to discharge
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order

If patient is Rh negative and gestational age greater than or equal to 20 weeks, order Fetal Maternal Hemorrhage and TM Rh Immune Globulin (RhIG/WinRho) (Module). If gestational age less than 20 weeks, then order TM Rh Immune Globulin (RhIG/WinRho). No Fetal Maternal Hemorrhage required
